attributes.action: Controls on ticket prices for football league games in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The average UK season ticket price in the 'Price of Football 2015' survey conducted by the BBC found that on average the UK Premier League season ticket ranges from £294-£1,014 with the largest amount of these tickets sitting somewhere around the £500 mark. This contrasted with the top flight European teams where the cheapest season ticket ranges between £73.88-£320.90 is outrageous.This issue is reflective of match day tickets throughout the football league and NEEDS addressing.
attributes.background: It is increasingly becoming an issue in British football where ticket prices are rising year on year. This is effectively creating a culture where the heritage of the sport and nation is becoming increasingly marginalized to the middle class.

rejection.details:
The Government and Parliament don't control the prices for Premier League tickets.

You could ask the Government or Parliament to offer incentives for clubs to reduce the price of tickets - for example, through the tax system.
